titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Howard A. Meyerhoff Papers, 1898-1988
titlestmt.author: Processed by Madison White

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Madison White March 2018

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: The Howard A. Meyerhoff Collection contains the personal and professional papers of Howard A. Meyerhoff, a geologist, professor of geology at Smith College, and chair of the editorial board for the American Association for the Advancement of Science.

bioghist.head: Biography of Howard A. Meyerhoff
bioghist.p: Howard A. Meyerhoff (1899-1982), a geologist, was professor of geology at Smith College from 1925-1949, administrative secretary and chair of the editorial board for the American Association for the Advancement of Science from 1949-1953, a member of the Scientific Manpower Commission from 1953-1965, and head of the Geology Department at the University of Pennsylvania from 1962-1967. He was also chairman of the board of Propper-McCallum Hosiery Co. from 1938-1947, a mediator for the National War Labor Board from 1943-1944, a founder of GeoSurveys, Inc., an expert on copyright, a founder of the Northeastern Section of the Geological Society of America, an investor in mining ventures and a consultant. Meyerhoff was an authority on the geology of Puerto Rico and the Caribbean Basin and a critic of the plate tectonic and continental drift theories. He was author of numerous articles, including some co-authored by his son A.A. Meyerhoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains business and personal correspondence (1925-1982); professional files; field notebooks (1916-1933); maps; manuscripts; memorandums; reports; speeches; legal documents; biographical information; and miscellaneous other materials. Correspondents include geologists, business associates and General Lewis B. Hershey, who directed military drafts from World War II through the Vietnam War.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Howard A. Meyerhoff at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Received from Howard A. Meyerhoff, 1971-1978 and Sophie Meyerhoff, 1982-1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Madison White in April 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
